--- Colin Green <cgreen@...> wrote:
> Has anyone been following the DARPA Grand Challenge?

<snip>

I have, and I'm interested in ANN applications.  In
particular, for steering and navigation.  Here's
something I posted to the ANNEvolve mailing list:
--------------------------------------------
Today was the big robot desert race that fizzled.  All
the contestants did lousy.  But Eric and I were
talking about doing a much-simplified simulation of
that problem.   We would use a minimal car model,
traveling in a rectangular region, with "boulders". 
The "boulders" are just small circles like the island
in EvSail.  So there are several circular forbidden
regions of different sizes within the large
rectangular region.   An ANN controls power and
steering of the car, and is supposed to guide it. 
It's goal is to travel from lower left to upper right
without hitting any "boulders".  Besides that, it
should do it as fast as possible.  The inputs to the
ANN tell it where the goal is and where the nearby
boulders are.

But I don't want to do this by myself.  Eric is
willing to be the project manager.  I will do the
mathematics and the physical modeling, and maybe some
C code.  I can give lots of advice and explanations if
needed.  We need one or two programmers.  The reason I
mention two is that I would like this project to
include some basic graphics.  I want to see the region
with the boulders, and see the car moving through it.
--------------------------------------------------

I anyone would like to apply NEAT to this same
problem, I willing to provide my vehicle model, along
with the terrain, boulders, sensor inputs, etc.  I
have not written this yet, but I expect it to be
similar to the sailboat model used in EvSail (see our
website).  So I think I can get it out rather quickly.
My approach is highly simplified when compared to a
real vehicle on real desert terrain, but I believe it
models the most essential aspects of the situation.


=====
Mitchell Timin
http://annevolve.sourceforge.net
